3153~This point is used to train skills. The higher the level of the skill, the more AP you need. You gain AP when you level up, age, or complete an important quest. Despite the importance of AP's role in developing your character, it's not good to overly rely on AP. If your character stops growing due to the complete lack of AP, you can gain AP by aging.
3154~You need EXP to raise your level. You can gain it through various means such as skills, quests, part-time jobs, combat, lessons, etc.
3155~Strength represents the physical strength of the character. As Strength increases, you can make stronger attacks and gain bonuses on skills related to Strength.
3156~Intelligence represents the excellence of the character's rational capability. As Intelligence increases, you can understand books easily and gain bonuses on skills related to Intelligence.
3157~Dexterity represents the means of or the skill to work. As Dexterity increases, you can build items better and gain bonuses on skills related to Dexterity.
3158~Will represents the mental power to accomplish tasks. As Will increases, you can survive through moments of danger, and you can gain bonuses in various circumstances and skills that need to be accomplished or achieved with Will.
3159~Luck instigates the mysterious phenomena that are helpful to you. As Luck increases, you can experience good things that you did not expect. You can gain bonuses on various skills related to Luck.
3160~This is the power that maintains life. You become disabled when Life turns 0. With high Life, you can survive in combat with powerful enemies.
3161~This represents the magical energy generated through the power of Eweca. Once you run out of Mana, you can't cast magic anymore. It's very important to raise the max Mana capacity as Mana is only replenished though potions or at night when Eweca rises.
3162~This is the basic energy need in an action. This energy is applied to various kinds of actions, so you must watch this stat carefully. With high Stamina, you can do more work without resting.
3163~This is another kind of name given to you. The title comes after your name and it's visible to those around you. You can change your title in the Character window.
3164~Gold is Erinn's currency unit. It's used in most financial activities in Erinn.
3165~Fabric woven with thread. It's used as the raw material in tailoring.
3166~Fibroid material braided long for elasticity. You can weave fabric with this.

4414~A kit that allows you set up a camp. If your Campfire skill rank is F or higher, and you are in an adequate place, you can set up camp by right-clicking on it and clicking on "Use". You can cook, rest, burn things, or do camp sharing in the camp fire inside a camp. When you are the owner of a camp, you can resurrect back to the camp with a minor penalty when you get knocked out. But if you give up the ownership, you cannot resurrect there. The camping kit disappears when you take down the camp.

6569~A contract for a Brownie that can be hired for weaving. Leave this contract inside the house inventory, and a Brownie with a Rank D in Weaving skill will appear. Set up a spinning wheel or a loom, along with the necessary items needed to weave, and the Brownie will work on an item until it's completed. Once the contract is over, the Brownie will cease working for you, and be aware that you can only receive completed items. (Not available for transaction)
6575~A contract for a Brownie that can be hired for refining. Leave this contract inside the house inventory, and a Brownie with a Rank D in Refining skill will appear. Set up the anvil and the necessary items needed to refine, and the Brownie will work on an item until it's completed. 8188~Once taken, for 5 minutes, the HP & MP recovery rate will increase by 10x, while the stamina recovery rate will increase by 5x. \nThe recovery rate from injury will also increase by 2 points every 5 seconds.\nThe increased rate is based on the normal recovery rate, and does not add on to the effects of rest, meditation, or campfire. Taking a multiple number of these at once will do no good.\nIn fact, doing so may put the user at risk of overdosing.

8287~Artifact detector which uses lights and sounds. Walking around with this equipped allows detection of hidden artifacts in the ground nearby.\nThe closer to the artifact, the longer the light on the L-Rod will stay lit, and the louder, and more frequently sounds will emanate. 8982~Artifact detector which uses lights and sounds. Walking around with this equipped allows detection of hidden artifacts in the ground nearby.\nThe closer to the artifact, the longer the light on the L-Rod will stay lit, and the louder, and more frequently sounds will emanate. 9057~Select this license by right-clicking on it with your mouse, and you will be able to open the Personal Shop at the Filia Town Square and the west entrance of the town. 9080~Beginner's bow from Vena offered free-of-charge.\nUse this to practice the basics of archery. \nClick on a target in-range to begin aiming, and the number indicating your accuracy will begin to ascend. When the accuracy percentage reaches the desired level, click the target again to release the shot.\n\nRemember to utilize the fleet feet of Elves to maintain safe distances from your targets, and always strive for high accuracy for the best results.

11974~This detector, when held with both hands, reacts with light and sound as it detects the presence of artifacts that have been hidden by magic.\nThe closer you are to the artifact, the light will shine longer and the sound will beep louder and more frequently.  If the sound beeps consecutively 4 times, it means that the hidden artifact is very close.  When this happens, you should immediately press the hotkey X and use the mouse cursor to click near the area where you think the artifact is. (Not repairable)
11975~This is an L-Rod, bestowed by the Spirit of Wind, and it has the power to dig through ice and snow. If the sound beeps consecutively 4 times, it means that the hidden artifact is very close.  When this happens, you should immediately press the hotkey X and use the mouse cursor to click near the area where you think the artifact is. (Not repairable)

12931~Right-click on this license and then click on 'Use' to open up a Personal Shop near Tir Chonaill Bank & the Moon Gate, as well as in Dugald Aisle. The income generated during the shop is stored on this license, and you can deposit it at the bank like a check to cash it.
12932~A special merchant license sold under Bebhinn's name. It is very affordable, with a Gold limit of 50,000. If you are standing at one of these designated places, a blue sign will appear under the license, stating that you can set up shop in this area. The income generated during the shop is stored on this license, and you can deposit it at the bank like a check to cash it.

14775~Artifact detector which uses lights and sounds. Walking around with this equipped allows detection of hidden artifacts in the ground nearby.\nThe closer to the artifact, the longer the light on the L-Rod will stay lit, and the louder, and more frequently sounds will emanate. When the detector sounds four beeps in a row, this means there is an artifact very close-by. Press the short-cut button <hotkey name="UseLRod"/>, and click on the ground nearby to reveal artifacts. (Cannot be repaired) 
14776~Artifact detector which uses lights and sounds. Walking around with this equipped allows detection of hidden artifacts in the ground nearby.\nThe closer to the artifact, the longer the light on the L-Rod will stay lit, and the louder, and more frequently sounds will emanate. When the detector sounds four beeps in a row, this means there is an artifact very close-by. Press the short-cut button <hotkey name="UseLRod"/>, and click on the ground nearby to reveal artifacts.
14777~Artifact detector which uses lights and sounds. Walking around with this equipped allows detection of hidden artifacts in the ground nearby.\nThe closer to the artifact, the longer the light on the L-Rod will stay lit, and the louder, and more frequently sounds will emanate. When the detector sounds four beeps in a row, this means there is an artifact very close-by. Press the short-cut button <hotkey name="UseLRod"/>, and click on the ground nearby to reveal artifacts. (Cannot be repaired) 
14778~An L-Rod featuring the spirits of the hot wind that has the effect of pushing the air upwards. It has the power to stack up the sand, so when using the Landmaker action with this equipped, this will enable you to stack up the sand on the sandy hill of Connous Desert higher and higher.\nWhen using the explore action to detect an artifact, the closer the L-Rod is to the artifact, the light that produces stays on longer, with larger, more frequent beeps\nWhen it beeps 4 times, it's a signal that the artifact is right on the spot, so press <hotkey name=""UseLRod""/> and click on the ground where you may suspect the artifact is hiding.
14779~An L-Rod featuring the spirits of the cold wind that has the effect of sinking the air downwards. It has the power to dig up sand and others, so when using the Landmaker action with this equipped, the sandy hill of Connous deserts could soon be dug up deeper and deeper into the ground.\nWhen using the explore action to detect an artifact, the closer the L-Rod is to the artifact, the light that produces stays on longer, with larger, more frequent beeps\nWhen it beeps 4 times, it's a signal that the artifact is right on the spot, so press <hotkey name="UseLRod"/> and click on the ground where you may suspect the artifact is hiding.

14784~This is an L-Rod, bestowed by the Spirit of Wind, and it has the power to dig through ice and snow.  If you use the Land Maker action while holding this, you can dig through the thick layer of snow at the Physis snowfield.\nWhen using the Detect action to search for artifacts; the light will shine longer and it will beep louder and more frequently the closer you approach the artifact.  If the sound beeps consecutively 4 times, it means that the hidden artifact is very close.  When this happens, you should immediately press the hotkey <hotkey name=""UseLRod""/> and use the mouse cursor to click near the area where you think the artifact is. (Not repairable)

22246~This point is used to train skills. The higher the level of the skill, the more AP you need. You gain AP when you level up, age, or complete an important quest. Despite the importance of AP's role in developing your character, it's not good to overly rely on AP. If your character stops growing due to the complete lack of AP, you can gain AP by aging.
22247~You need EXP to raise your level. You can gain it through various means such as skills, quests, part-time jobs, combat, lessons, etc.
22248~Strength represents the physical strength of the character. As Strength increases, you can make stronger attacks and gain bonuses on skills related to Strength.
22249~Intelligence represents the excellence of the character's rational capability. As Intelligence increases, you can understand books easily and gain bonuses on skills related to Intelligence.
22250~Dexterity represents the means of or the skill to work. As Dexterity increases, you can build items better and gain bonuses on skills related to Dexterity.
22251~Will represents the mental power to accomplish tasks. As Will increases, you can survive through moments of danger, and you can gain bonuses in various circumstances and skills that need to be accomplished or achieved with Will.
22252~Luck instigates the mysterious phenomena that are helpful to you. As Luck increases, you can experience good things that you did not expect. You can gain bonuses on various skills related to Luck.
22253~This is the power that maintains life. You become disabled when Life turns 0. With high Life, you can survive in combat with powerful enemies.
22254~This represents the magical energy generated through the power of Eweca. Once you run out of Mana, you can't cast magic anymore. It's very important to raise the max Mana capacity as Mana is only replenished through potions or at night when Eweca rises.
22255~This is the basic energy need in an action. This energy is applied to various kinds of actions, so you must watch this stat carefully. With high Stamina, you can do more work without resting.
22256~This is another kind of name given to you. The title comes after your name and it's visible to those around you. You can change your title in the Character window.
22257~Gold is Erinn's currency unit. It's used in most financial activities in Erinn.
22258~Fabric woven with thread. It's used as the raw material in tailoring.

23022~A contract for a Brownie that can be hired for weaving. Leave this contract inside the house inventory, and a Brownie with a Rank D in Weaving skill will appear. Set up a spinning wheel or a loom, along with the necessary items needed to weave, and the Brownie will produce an item for you. Remember, the Brownie will stop working for you once the contract expires, allowing you to receiving only the completed item. (Not Available for Transaction)

30101~Beginner's bow from Vena offered free-of-charge.\nUse this to practice the basics of archery. \nClick on a target in-range to begin aiming, and the number indicating your accuracy will begin to ascend. The closer this value reaches to 100%, the more accurate will be your shot. When the accuracy percentage reaches the desired level, click the target again to release the shot.\n\nRemember to utilize the fleet feet of Elves to maintain safe distances from your targets, and always strive for high accuracy for the best results.

30427~Artisan Upgrade Restoration Kit
30431~A kit that allows you to undo an Artisan Upgrade. Using this kit will return your equipment to the stage previous to the Artisan Upgrade. When used, the consumed EXP will be returned and you will be able to perform an Artisan Upgrade or a Normal Upgrade on the item again. If an additional upgrade has been performed on the item since the Artisan Upgrade, it cannot be restored.

30825~Unrestricted Dungeon Pass

30828~Use this pass at a dungeon lobby in Uladh to enter any Basic, Intermediate, or Advanced dungeon. It will also lift any dungeon restrictions on the number of party members allowed. (For example, you'd be able to enter a 3-person dungeon by yourself or with 4 other players). However, this pass does not permit access to Boss Trial Dungeons.

31214~A spiked knuckle blessed by Goibne. Three spikes jut from the Knuckles to increase their attack while protecting the wearer's hand. A Knuckle attack beginning with a body check shifts into a tackle when your opponent falls, allowing an opportunity for another attack.
31215~A hobnail knuckle blessed by Goibne. Four round spikes increase the knuckle's attack rate and provides double padding for the hand for a more pwoerful hit. A Knuckle attack beginning with a body check shifts into a tackle when your opponent falls, allowing an opportunity for another attack.
31216~A bear knuckle blessed by Goibne. This knuckle has been made with the highest quality bear leather from Physis. It provides protection all the way around to the back of the hand.
31217~A bipennis blessed by Goibne. The processes made to craft this double-bladed axe are ancient compared to most weapons found today.
31218~A one-handed axe blessed by Goibne. Its destructive power has been maximized, making it perfect for knocking enemies down.
31219~A hammer blessed by Goibne. Its inconsistent damage is compensated for by its extremely high maximum attack rate.
31220~A short blunt weapon featuring a hardened ironhead tip blessed by Goibne. A type of a club.
31221~This weapon has high Maximum Attack Strength as well as high Minimum Attack Strength. It can knock an enemy out with one hit, which can be disappointing for someone who likes intense fights.
31222~A one-handed sword with a wide blade that has been blessed by Goibne.  It is relatively light and easy to handle.
31223~A great sword blessed by Goibne. Though primitive, it's so large that it seems only a Giant could wield it. In spite of its size, the edge of the blade is skillfully crafted, and its attack rate is a match for any other sword.
31224~A one-handed slashing sword been blessed by Goibne. Top-heavy and curved, the edge of this blade is perfect for cutting.
31225~A large single-bladed axe blessed by Goibne. The axe's thick blade is deadly, but it looks ridiculously heavy.
31226~A giant metal hammer blessed by Goibne. A difficult weapon to handle, even for experienced warriors.  Its impact, however, is mind-boggling.
31227~A Claymore of simple design that the warriors of the Highlands use. It is more lethal than a regular Claymore.
31228~A two-handed sword with a sharp, thin, flexible edge. In the hands of a skilled warrior, this weapon has no equal.
31229~An executioner's sword blessed by Goibne. The blade and handle are shaped to resemble a magnificent wing.
31230~A two-handed sword blessed by Goibne. It is only given to knights who have accomplished great deeds.
31231~A dragon blade blessed by Goibne. It was designed to look like a dragon's fang, and its craftmanship is unrivaled. Legend has it that a sword truly made from the fang of a dragon is out there.
31232~An instrument with 8 strings. It's easier to play tremolo compared to a lute. The spiked blades around the edges allow it to be used as a weapon if need be.
31233~A trinity staff blessed by Goibne. Allows you to use magic of all three elements. As you use magic of a certain element, you gain charges of that element; however, you can only gain charges in one element at a time.
31234~A wand imbued with a Lightning Elemental.\nIt augments all lightning spells.\nHolding it unites body and Mana, allowing you to use Meditation while running.\nHowever, all Mana connected to the wand will vanish if it leaves your hand.
31235~A wand imbued with an Ice Elemental.\nIt augments all ice spells.\nHolding it unites body and Mana, allowing you to use Meditation while running.\nHowever, all Mana connected to the wand will vanish if it leaves your hand.
31236~A wand imbued with a Fire Elemental.\nIt augments all fire spells.\nHolding it unites body and Mana, allowing you to use Meditation while running.\nHowever, all Mana connected to the wand will vanish if it leaves your hand.

31239~A fire wand blessed by Goibne.\nIt augments all fire spells.\nHolding it unites body and Mana, allowing you to use Meditation while running.\nHowever, all Mana connected to the wand will vanish if it leaves your hand.
31240~It's light and easy to use, yet effective. With both a high critical rate and balance, all beginning warriors want this as their first weapon.
31241~A specially-made dagger with a razor-sharp edge. Like the Dagger, it has a high critical rate and is very balanced.
31242~A longbow with a leather-wrapped grip, strengthening the bow while making it easier to hold.
31243~A bow optimized by years of research performed by the Elves. A thin metallic coat enhances the bow's elasticity, but it is difficult to aim without considerable skill.
31244~A rare relic of Irinid blessed by Goibne. A bow shaped like a bird's wing, it has excellent elasticity and can make multiple rapid shots over a decent range.
31245~A long bow used by the warriors of the Highlands, blessed by Goibne. It is made of sturdy aged wood. The grip features vintage engravings.
31246~A cylinder blessed by Goibne. This fire cylinder has been improved through the research of the Royal Alchemists. It greatly improves fire alchemy, but is less efficient when using other types of alchemy.
31247~A cylinder blessed by Goibne. This clay cylinder has been improved through the research of the Royal Alchemists. It greatly improves clay alchemy, but is less efficient when using other types of alchemy.

32875~Gold Dye Ampoule
32876~A dye ampoule that allows you to apply gold dye to part of an item. Disappears after you use it once. (Cannot be traded.)
